definition: no cause, no reason (idiom); completely uncalled for

sentences.english: The cake maker shakes a naked snake with the qusimilarg rake without sake.
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕制造者无缘无故地用寒战的耙子摆一条赤裸的蛇。

sentences.english: This can cause tests to fail gratuitously.
sentences.chinese: 这会导致测试无缘无故地失败。

sentences.english: The cake dor shakes a naked snake dawn the quaking rake lacking sake.
sentences.chinese: 蛋糕制造者无缘无故地用抖动的耙子摇一条赤的蛇。

sentences.english: She sometimes angers with little or no provocation.
sentences.chinese: 她有时无缘无故就生气。

sentences.english: My report of resignation was fall into abeyance without sake.
sentences.chinese: 我的辞职报告无缘无故被搁置了。

sentences.english: Regularly checked rail lines, but derailments without apparent cause.
sentences.chinese: 定期接受检查的铁路线，但是却无缘无故地脱轨。

sentences.english: He was steaming badly over nothing.
sentences.chinese: 他无缘无故地乱发脾气。
“无缘无故”只能说是半真半假。

sentences.english: The gas company cut off our gas supply for no reason.
sentences.chinese: 煤气公司无缘无故中断了我们的煤气供应。

sentences.english: When peoples are mean to you for no reason. The reason is usually jealousy.
sentences.chinese: 当一个人无缘无故对你很小气苛刻，通常是因为嫉妒。

sentences.english: He had been trying to fancy them causeless , but could not.
sentences.chinese: 他曾试图想象他们无缘无故，但不能。

sentences.english: It is illegal to demote an employee without reason.
sentences.chinese: 无缘无故将一名员工降级是违法的。

sentences.english: Shadowsong Panther will no longer prematurely despawn.
sentences.chinese: 影歌紫豹现在不会中途无缘无故消失了。

sentences.english: He often loses his temper for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 他常常无缘无故地使性子。

sentences.english: There are unreasoned joys, inexplicable miseries, laughters and remorses without a cause.
sentences.chinese: 时常有无缘无故的兴奋，痛苦，欢笑和悔恨。

sentences.english: He put me down for nothing at all.
sentences.chinese: 他无缘无故地斥责了我一顿。

definition: variant of 平白無故|平白无故[ping2 bai2 wu2 gu4]
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to vent one's anger on an innocent party (idiom)
to take one's anger out on sb (who does not deserve it)

pinyin: yi1 er2 zai4 , zai4 er2 san1

definition: most likely/mostly (in 8 or 9 cases out of 10)/vast majority
to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
